business.headline: Government scraps 14 quality norms to ease burden on key manufacturing sectorsBy lifting mandatory BIS certification requirements, the government has effectively simplified compliance, eliminated overlapping testing procedures, and accelerated approvals for both manufacturers and importers

Vijay Shekhar Sharma's resilient leadership helps Paytm stay profitable for the second quarter in a rowThe performance underscores his disciplined cost approach, focus on fundamentals-led growth and early push to embed AI across the business, which are now delivering tangible results.
Sensex, Nifty end flat as profit booking offsets positive triggersThe S&P BSE Sensex was up just 12.16 points to close at 84,478.67, while the NSE Nifty50 ended at 25,879.15, just 3 points up.

Want to be a crorepati? Here's how SIPs can help you reach Rs 1 croreSIPs allow people to invest small amounts regularly, and over time, these small steps can grow into meaningful wealth. Although Rs 1 crore sounds like a big number, it's achievable and can be built one SIP at a time.

You quit smoking and drinking. So why is your health insurance still costly?Even after quitting, insurers continue to charge higher premiums, and former smokers or drinkers are still treated as high-risk for years.

boAt founders step down before IPO: Should investors be concerned?Having been the face of their brands for years, these founders suddenly moving to non-executive positions has raised questions about intent and timing.

Fujiyama Power IPO opens for subscription: Check key details, latest GMPFujiyama Power has set its price band at Rs 216 to Rs 228 per share, with a lot size of 65 shares. At the upper end of the band, the IPO size stands at Rs 828 crore, comprising a fresh issue of Rs 600 crore (2.63 crore shares) and an OFS of Rs 228 crore (1 crore shares).

Ashok Leyland shares jump after Q2 results. Should you buy, hold or sell?Ashok Leyland's Q2 numbers lifted the stock, with analysts divided between strong margin-led optimism and concerns over the MHCV cycle's volatility. With targets ranging widely, is the next leg of growth convincing enough?

Honasa Consumer shares jump up to 9% after strong Q2 earnings: Should you buy?Honasa Consumer's strong Q2 turnaround, rising margins and category momentum have lifted the stock sharply, but stretched valuations and divided analyst views now raise the question: is the rally sustainable?

PhysicsWallah IPO struggles to find takers: Should you subscribe?Despite strong brand recognition and support from anchor investors, the IPO has so far been subscribed only 14%, reflecting weak investor interest.

Sensex, Nifty open slightly lower despite global optimism, record-low inflationAt around 9:21 am, the Sensex slipped 143 points to 84,323, while the Nifty50 fell 60 points to 25,816. Broader markets were also under pressure, indicating some profit booking after recent gains.

Gold, silver rate today: How will US shutdown end impact precious metals?After weeks of uncertainty, both houses of the US Congress have passed a deal to reopen the government, ending the longest shutdown in US history.

US government shutdown to end: Will it result in a rally for Sensex, Nifty?Stock market today: Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,950.5 points at 8:00 am, suggesting that the Nifty50 will open above Wednesday's closing level of 25,875.80.

Applying for a personal loan? Don't fall for these 5 common scam tacticsThe race to get fast loans has made many borrowers easy targets for fraudsters. Scammers use fake apps, urgent messages and sweet deals to trap people. Spotting the red flags can save you from serious financial trouble.

Gold prices continue to rise. Why are they climbing?After months of ups and downs, gold is once again on the rise. With fresh global triggers and growing demand, the metal is gaining strength. Here's a closer look at the factors fuelling the latest surge.

Retail inflation eases to record low of 0.25% in October as food prices fallThe latest consumer price index (CPI) print was well below expectations and marks the lowest reading since the current CPI series began in 2015, which uses 2012 as the base year.

Is your income tax refund delayed? Here's how interest is calculated on itWaiting endlessly for your tax refund can test anyone's patience. The silver lining? The government compensates you with interest for delays — at a fixed rate, calculated monthly. But there are rules, limits and exceptions. Let's decode them.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as US optimism sparks IT rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 595.19 points to close at 84,466.51, while the NSE Nifty50 added 180.85 points to end at 25,875.80.

Gold without the glitter: Why investors are moving away from physical goldIn October 2025, India recorded the third-highest gold ETF inflows globally, behind only the United States and China, a clear sign that the country's love for gold is being redefined in the digital era.

Buying a house just because you can afford the EMI? Think againThe calculator may say you can afford it, but life may say otherwise. A home loan is not just a financial decision — it impacts savings, career choices, and long-term stability.

entertainment.headline: After Govinda's statement, Sunita Ahuja apologises for her remarks on family priest Sunita Ahuja reacted to Govinda's apology over her remarks about their family priest. She said that she did not like Govinda apologising publicly on her behalf.

Kanu Behl says his film Agra denied shows; blames multiplexes, big blockbusters Kanu Behl expressed frustration over his film 'Agra' being denied shows at multiplexes. He urged audiences for support, while blaming the blockbusters.

Internet appalled as intruder grabs Ariana Grande, Cynthia Erivo comes to rescue An intruder jumped over the barricade at the 'Wicked For Good' Singapore premiere event to meet Ariana Grande. Cynthia Erivo came to Ariana's rescue.

Ajay Devgn says love has lost meaning after Kajol's marriage expiry date remark Actor Ajay Devgn said that love has lost its meaning in today's casual relationships. His co-star Madhavan agreed and compared modern love to affection for pets.

Amaal vs Gaurav on Bigg Boss 19: Singer calls himself product of reverse nepotism Tensions flared inside the 'Bigg Boss 19' house as Amaal Mallik and Gaurav Khanna engaged in a heated exchange. A new promo shows the two contestants clashing over the topic of nepotism.

Vijay Deverakonda praises Rashmika Mandanna: You are an amazing woman Vijay Deverakonda says he got emotional after watching 'The Girlfriend', praises Rashmika Mandanna and team for sparking social awareness.

Ahaan Panday shares rare family photo on Chikki Panday's birthday Ahaan Panday marked his father Chikki Panday's 59th birthday by sharing a childhood photograph on Instagram. He made his acting debut with 'Saiyaara' earlier this year.

Bigg Boss 19: Tanya Mittal on her mother's probable absence in family week Social media influencer Tanya Mittal opened up about her family's reaction to her 'Bigg Boss 19' participation. She revealed strained relations and uncertain family visits during the show.

Perfect Crown to Remarried Princess: First look of upcoming K-dramas out Disney+ has announced a slate of new K-dramas including royal romances and fantasy series. This move strengthens its position in the growing Asia-Pacific streaming market with high-profile renewals and productions.

Ranbir Kapoor's finsta confession: No Alia Bhatt, only reel with Raha Ranbir Kapoor recently revealed details about his private Instagram presence. He also explained his reasons for keeping his wife, Alia Bhatt, from following him.

Dulquer Salmaan shares Mammootty's take on acting: Only great actors can overact Dulquer Salmaan recently shared his father's perspective on acting and addressed compliments about his own skills during an interview about his upcoming film 'Kaantha'.

Mridul Tiwari's surprise eviction from Bigg Boss 19 sparks social media outcry Mridul Tiwari's sudden exit from Bigg Boss 19 during a surprise mid-week eviction has left viewers expressing disbelief and disappointment. Many social media users have questioned the move and questioned the fairness of the show's format.

Shehbaz's big Bigg Boss confusion: To use Shehnaaz's name or cry about it later? Shehbaz Badesha's journey in 'Bigg Boss 19' is turning into a masterclass in confusion. He keeps invoking sister Shehnaaz Gill's name for applause, only to later play the victim.

Gulshan Devaiah on Tamil debut with Madhavan's Legacy: Time to spread my wings Gulshan Devaiah, who is set to make his Tamil debut in the upcoming crime drama series 'Legacy', shares his thoughts on diversifying his filmography with a Tamil debut following his foray into Kannada cinema.

I knew Thamma worked when children started talking about it: Aaditya Sarpotdar Filmmaker Aaditya Sarpotdar reflected on the success of 'Thamma' and his journey within Maddock Films' growing horror-comedy universe, sharing insights on world-building, working with stars like Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna, and what lies ahead for the franchise.

Kichcha Sudeep wraps Mark, promises Christmas release as planned Kichcha Sudeep has completed shooting for his upcoming Kannada film 'Mark'. The film is set for a festive release on December 25, promising a thrilling box office clash with Arjun Janya's '45'.

Netflix this week: Delhi Crime Season 3, Jolly LLB 3, and more Netflix's new week of releases brings a thrilling mix of crime, romance, fantasy, and holiday drama, led by 'Delhi Crime' Season 3 and 'Jolly LLB 3'. With 'Dynamite Kiss' and 'A Quiet Place: Day One' adding to the variety, viewers are in for a binge-worthy lineup.

Comic Ashish Chanchlani to host Globetrotter event, makers drop fun video A quirky reveal video featuring Ashish Chanchlani and SS Rajamouli has taken social media by storm, as the makers officially announced the YouTuber as the host of the upcoming 'Globetrotter' event.

Dulquer Salmaan admits criticism affects him: Some people say I can't act Ahead of the release of 'Kaantha', Dulquer Salmaan reflects on a recurring criticism that he can't act and how it pushes him to constantly raise the bar.

general news.headline: Delhi bomber imposed Taliban-style rules: Al-Falah students during sting operationAfter speaking with several students and staff, the India Today team learnt that Dr Umar Mohammad, the suicide bomber of the i20 car blast near the Red Fort on November 10, followed strict segregation practices in his classroom. Students said he enforced the "Taliban model" during his lectures.

Stop treating all Kashmiris as suspects: Omar Abdullah after Delhi terror attackAbdullah questioned the government's failure to prosecute individuals earlier dismissed for alleged terror links and criticised the "siloed" governance structure in Jammu and Kashmir that excludes elected leaders from security decisions.

2 unconscious after Shreya Ghoshal's performance at Cuttack event turns chaoticA large crowd at Shreya Ghoshal's live concert on the concluding day of Cuttack's Bali Jatra festival led to chaos, leaving two people unconscious. Visitors had surged towards the stage, causing panic and some collapses due to suffocation.

Rubio calls Delhi car blast 'terrorist attack,' praises India's 'measured' probeMarco Rubio called the Red Fort car blast a clear terror attack, praised India's professional probe and warned the incident carries wider risks, while reaffirming US confidence in New Delhi's handling.

OnePlus 15 launched: Top specs, key features, India price and everything else to knowAfter weeks of teasers and leaks, OnePlus has officially launched its new flagship, the OnePlus 15, in India. Here is a look at its top specs, key features, India price and everything else that you need to know.

If officials repeat their 2020 mistake....: Tejashwi's warning before Bihar resultTejashwi Yadav reaffirmed confidence in Mahagathbandhan's victory ahead of Bihar results, warning officials against any repeat of alleged 2020 irregularities.

Explained: Supreme Court's tough questions to petitioners against SIR in Tamil Nadu, BengalThe recently-concluded Assembly polls in Bihar could have ramifications that may resonate well beyond the political arena. The first signs emerged on Tuesday during the Supreme Court's hearing of petitions against the SIR exercise in Tamil Nadu and West Bengal.

Exclusive: Actors, politicians' names emerge in Dawood-linked drug syndicate probeNames of actors and politicians emerged during Mumbai Police's probe into Dawood-linked drug syndicate. Wanted drug lord Salim Dola's son, Taher Dola, claimed that these actors and politicians attended parties organised by him.

I got irritated: Upset over honking, Bengaluru techie rams 3 on scooterA CCTV video showed a man ramming into a scooter on Bengaluru road and speeding past. During questioning, the techie said he hit them as he got irritated due to continuous honking.

Revoking Article 370 hasn't ended terrorism: Omar Abdullah after Delhi blastTaking a dig at the Narendra Modi government, Omar Abdullah said that the terror incidents near Delhi's Red Fort and Pahalgam earlier this year indicates that the Centre's objective of eliminating terrorism from Jammu and Kashmir by revoking its special status has failed.

NDA again or Mahagathbandhan gain? All eyes on Bihar vote count todayBihar is set for a high-voltage counting day on Friday as votes for all 243 assembly constituencies are tallied under tight security. The Election Commission has deployed over 14,000 personnel across 38 districts, with counting to begin at 8 am.

Al-Falah University director tied to 15 firms; 7 have same address in Delhi areaPublic records show Al Falah University director Jawad Ahmad Siddiqui linked to 15 companies involved in sectors ranging from education to agribusiness and software. Several of these firms share the same Jamia Nagar address and overlapping directors, including names also connected with Al Falah University.

Ananya Panday says Gen Z is emotionally liberated. But is that really true?Gen Z loves to talk about their emotions, but sometimes maybe a little too much. Does this emotional openness make them a bit too sensitive?

Bihar will see scenes like Bangladesh if...: RJD leader sparks row ahead of D-DayThe RJD leader said that he had asked all officials involved in counting not to tamper with the public mandate, warning that if they did so, Bihar could witness unrest similar to what was seen in Nepal, Bangladesh, and Sri Lanka.

Sena leader dupes pani puri seller of Rs 3 lakh by 'selling' Mumbai footpathA pani puri seller has accused a Mulund-based Shiv Sena leader of fraudulently 'selling' a chunk of footpath to him for Rs 3 lakh in 2023. Two years have now passed, but the pani puri seller has neither been handed over the space nor the money.

Out on bail in school jobs scam, ex-Bengal minister names co-accused as girlfriendBack in 2021, the Mamata Banerjee government was left red-faced when the Enforcement Directorate recovered Rs 50 crore from Arpita Mukherjee's flats, leading to the arrest of both Arpita and Partha in connection with the scam. What also set rumour mills spinning was the discovery of sex toys.

Chandrayaan-3 returns to the Moon for rare flyby, sends critical dataThis unique gravitational tour has provided the Indian Space Research Organisation (Isro) with a treasure trove of operational data, offering new insights into spacecraft navigation and orbital mechanics.

Live: Amit Shah reviews Red Fort terror blast probe in meeting with NSA, top officialsDelhi Red Fort Blast Live Updates: A powerful explosion ripped through a Hyundai i20 near Delhi's Red Fort Metro Station at around 6.50 pm on Monday, killing 13 people and injuring 20 others. The explosion took place in a slow-moving car that had stopped at a red light just outside the Red Fort metro station. The Union Cabinet on Wednesday officially classified the blast as a "terrorist act" carried out by "anti-national elements." Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.

UK restaurant where Gandhi dined faces closure, top British chefs rally to save itBritain's oldest Indian restaurant, Veeraswamy, visited by Mahatma Gandhi, Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi, and other famous personalities, is facing closure after nearly a century in London. The Crown Estate plans to convert its Regent Street site into offices. Top British chefs have urged the Crown to preserve the restaurant in its 'rightful home'.

boAt founders step down before IPO: Should investors be concerned?Having been the face of their brands for years, these founders suddenly moving to non-executive positions has raised questions about intent and timing.

Longest US shutdown ends, but the massive damage is here to stay | 5 pointsThe longest shutdown in US history may have officially ended, but its aftershocks will linger. From grounded planes and frozen paychecks to missing economic data and shattered trust in federal aid, America's systems are crippled because of the lapse in appropriation. With another shutdown looming on January 30, the relief from Trump's reopening could be short-lived.

Referendum in Bangladesh along with polls, Yunus shredded by Jamaat, BNPAlong with the national election in January, Bangladesh will hold a referendum on four key issues, said Muhammad Yunus, the head of the interim administration. The vote, crucial to implementing the July Charter for political reforms, has drawn criticism from the BNP and the Jamaat-e-Islami, who accused Yunus of ignoring people's demands.

8 charred to death in Pune after goods truck collides with six vehicles on bridgeFollowing the collision, several vehicles went up in flames, resulting in the deaths of eight people. Officials expressed concerns that the death toll could mount further.

Delhi blast punishment will warn world against attacking India again: Amit ShahThe Home Minister emphasised that under the leadership of Prime Minister Modi, India is moving forward with zero tolerance towards terrorism and a commitment to rural empowerment and national security.

After Govinda's statement, Sunita Ahuja apologises for her remarks on family priestSunita Ahuja reacted to Govinda's apology over her remarks about their family priest. She said that she did not like Govinda apologising publicly on her behalf.

Kanu Behl says his film Agra denied shows; blames multiplexes, big blockbustersKanu Behl expressed frustration over his film 'Agra' being denied shows at multiplexes. He urged audiences for support, while blaming the blockbusters.

sports.headline: Varun Chakravarthy named Tamil Nadu captain for Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy Varun Chakravarthy has been appointed captain of Tamil Nadu for this season's Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. They begin their campaign against Rajasthan on November 26 in Ahmedabad.

Agra welcome home World Cup star Deepti Sharma with 10 km roadshow Agra turned out in huge numbers to welcome home Deepti Sharma after India's historic Women's World Cup win. The all-rounder received a 10km roadshow celebration as the city honoured her tournament-defining performances.

South Africa must frustrate Rishabh Pant and play on his emotions: Mark Boucher Mark Boucher has advised South Africa to counter Rishabh Pant's aggressive batting by playing on his ego and employing strategic field placements in the upcoming Test series against India. Pant will be making a comeback to international cricket after four months having recently recovered from a toe fracture sustained in England.

Sports Minister urges dialogue as I-League clubs seek solution to AIFF–ISL deadlock Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has stepped in as Indian football's crisis deepens, meeting I-League representatives to hear their concerns. He has urged AIFF, ISL and I-League stakeholders to begin constructive dialogue immediately.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: Can RCB strengthen their Hazlewood-reliant pace attack? RCB's title-winning formula revolved around Josh Hazlewood's brilliance and Rajat Patidar's leadership. As they prepare for IPL 2026, the defending champions must expand their pace depth and find support for their Australian spearhead.

IND vs SA 1st Test Predicted XI: Will India field spin trio of Axar, Kuldeep, Washington? India face a genuine selection dilemma ahead of the first Test, with Shubman Gill admitting uncertainty over the bowling balance. The Eden Gardens surface has kept the door open for both a three-spinner and three-seamer combination.

Jemima Rodrigues Exclusive: Inside India's Historic World Cup Win & The Chase That Changed Everything On this India Today Special Report, World Cup champion Jemima Rodrigues speaks exclusively about the Indian Women's Cricket Team's historic 2025 World Cup victory. Rodrigues details the thrilling semi-final chase against Australia, her own unbeaten 127-run innings, and the newfound fame that has followed the team's success. She also reflects on the crucial contributions from teammates like Deepti Sharma and Richa Ghosh, and the immense pressure of the tournament. In the interview, Rodrigues reveals her mindset during the critical match: 'I just want to do it to help India win. It's not about me. It's not about my score. It's about making India win.' The conversation also covers her journey to the Women's Big Bash League in Australia immediately following the win.

IND-A vs SA-A: Ruturaj Gaikwad's ton steers India to 4-wicket win in 1st ODI Ruturaj Gaikwad's brilliant century helped India A secure a four-wicket victory over South Africa A in the first unofficial ODI. Gaikwad played a magnificent innings of 117 (129) to help India chase down 286 in 49.3 overs.

IND vs SA 1st Test, pitch and weather conditions: Will Eden Gardens spin from Day 1? India host South Africa in a two-match Test series starting November 14 at Eden Gardens. The sporting pitch and clear weather promise an exciting contest with both teams eager to assert dominance.

India has been at the heart of SA20's journey from the start: Graeme Smith SA20 commissioner Graeme Smith says India's support has been crucial to the league's growth since its launch. With IPL-owned teams and rising fan engagement, SA20 is strengthening its footprint ahead of Season 4.

Yashasvi Jaiswal not aiming to replace Kohli, Rohit in Tests: Can't fill their shoes Yashasvi Jaiswal says he is not trying to fill the shoes of Rohit Sharma or Virat Kohli as India enters a new Test era. With South Africa up next, the young opener remains focused on backing his own strengths.

Rodrigues details the thrilling semi-final chase against Australia, her own unbeaten 127-run innings, and the newfound fame that has followed the team's success. She also reflects on the crucial contributions from teammates like Deepti Sharma and Richa Ghosh, and the immense pressure of the tournament. In the interview, Rodrigues reveals her mindset during the critical match: 'I just want to do it to help India win. It's not about me. It's not about my score. It's about making India win.' The conversation also covers her journey to the Women's Big Bash League in Australia immediately following the win.

Watch: Alyssa Healy exorcises Jemimah, World Cup demons with calm catch in WBBLAustralian captain Alyssa Healy redeemed herself from a World Cup mishap by taking a crucial catch and scoring 37 off 26 for the Sydney Sixers in the WBBL. Despite her efforts, the Hobart Hurricanes chased down 152 with six wickets in hand.

Mohammed Shami emerges as top DC, LSG trade target ahead of IPL 2026: ReportsThe IPL trade window is heating up and Mohammed Shami has quickly become one of the most sought-after names. With both Delhi Capitals and Lucknow Super Giants showing interest, SRH may soon have a big call to make.

Watch: Ben Stokes fires deadly warning to Australia with 6-wicket haul in Ashes warmupAshes 2025: Ben Stokes stole the spotlight in England's Ashes warm-up, claiming a six-wicket haul against the England Lions at Lilac Hill Park, signalling his devastating form ahead of the series.

Winning in India will be second greatest victory after WTC triumph: Temba BavumaSouth Africa's Test captain Temba Bavuma has said that a series win in India will be the team's second greatest achievement after their World Test Championship triumph. India and South Africa are set to lock horns in a two-match series beginning on November 14.

Bangladesh on cusp of huge win in Sylhet Test as Ireland slump furtherBangladesh tightened their grip on the Sylhet Test, finishing Day 3 just five wickets away from a huge innings victory over Ireland. After posting 587/8d, the hosts reduced Ireland to 86/5, leaving them trailing by 215 runs.

After Shardul Thakur, Sherfane Rutherford traded to Mumbai IndiansMumbai Indians have strengthened their IPL 2026 squad by acquiring Sherfane Rutherford from Gujarat Titans and Shardul Thakur from Lucknow Super Giants, bolstering both their batting and bowling options.

China asks Sumit Nagal to reapply with full documents after visa denial for Aus OpenChina responded to Indian tennis star Sumit Nagal's claim of an unexplained visa rejection by saying he must reapply with all required documents. The Foreign Ministry maintained that visas are issued to athletes according to established regulations.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: Can Gujarat Titans solve their middle-order muddle?IPL 2026: Gujarat Titans boast a strong top order and an effective bowling attack, but their middle order remains a concern, an area they must strengthen to become a more formidable side in next year's tournament.

The Foreign Ministry maintained that visas are issued to athletes according to established regulations.

Lakshya storms into Kumamoto Masters QF, HS Prannoy knocked outLakshya Sen stormed into the Kumamoto Masters quarterfinals with one of his most dominant wins of the season, keeping India's hopes alive in the men's singles draw. HS Prannoy, however, bowed out after a straight-game loss to Rasmus Gemke.

Rohit, Kohli need rhythm and runs in every series before 2027 World Cup: PujaraCheteshwar Pujara believes Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma must regain rhythm consistently as they approach the 2027 ODI World Cup. With both playing only one format, every series now becomes crucial to staying sharp and in form.

IPL 2026: Shardul Thakur traded to Mumbai Indians from LSG for Rs 2 croreShardul Thakur has been traded to Mumbai Indians (MI) from Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) for Rs 2 Crore ahead of the Indian Premier League 2026 (IPL 2026). Thakur played ten matches for LSG in IPL 2025 and scalped 13 wickets

Jemimah Rodrigues mesmerises fans, sings Ye Dosti after Women's World Cup winIn an interview with India Today, Indian cricketer Jemimah Rodrigues delighted fans by singing the iconic song Yeh Dosti from the classic film Sholay. The performance came shortly after she played a key role in India's Women's World Cup triumph.

England should revive sandpaper gate trauma to derail Steve Smith, says PanesarMonty Panesar has urged England to revive the Sandpapergate controversy and target Steve Smith mentally ahead of the Ashes opener, calling sledging a "strategic masterstroke." Smith, however, has a history of thriving under pressure.

World Cup win second turning point for Indian women's cricket: Jemimah RodriguesIn an interview with India Today, Jemimah Rodrigues said India's Women's World Cup triumph marked the second major turning point for women's cricket in the country, the first being their runners-up finish at the 2017 World Cup in England and Wales.

Rishabh Pant on recovery from toe fracture: Never easy to come back after injuryRishabh Pant reflects on his challenging road to recovery from a toe fracture, sharing insights on his mental resilience and gratitude as he prepares to return to Test cricket after four months. Rishabh Pant suffered a toe fracture during the fourth Test in England.

1st Test: Young India braces for WTC champions South Africa's spin threatIND vs SA, 1st Test: The young Indian side, led by Shubman Gill, will be put to a stern examination by South Africa's formidable spin attack in Kolkata. The WTC champions will also be aiming for their first Test win in India since 2010.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
